# Draft:The War Horse (newsroom)

}}
The War Horse is a nonprofit newsroom dedicated to news reporting on military and veterans affairs. It was founded in 2016 by Nicholas Brennan.
History
The War Horse was founded in 2016 by Nicholas Brennan, a journalist and former United States Marine who served in Iraq and Afghanistan. Its board of directors include Mich√®le Flournoy and Robert Jon Rosenthal, and the outlet has received backing from numerous major philanthropic organizations and prominent journalists, including MacArthur Foundation, the Ford Foundation, and Donald Graham.
In March 2017, the publication reported that the Department of Defense was investigating soldiers who had been soliciting and spreading naked pictures of female soldiers and veterans. The reporting was quickly picked up by national outlets, including The New York Times, sparking backlash from both lawmakers and the Pentagon.
Awards
The War Horse has received four Edward R. Murrow Awards, in 2018, 2021, 2022, and 2024. In 2021, The War Horse received the Robert F. Kennedy Journalism Award.
